alert.note: Alert for Marion (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 2:40PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Marion County through 330 PM CDT... At 240 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms 9 miles south of Sewanee, or 12 miles northwest of Bridgeport, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jasper, South Pittsburg, Whitwell, Kimball, Powells Crossroads, Orme, Martin Springs, Haletown (guild), Hicks Gap State Park and Sequatchie Cave. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for east Tennessee.
